item.title: Matt add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "A fanatic is one who can't change his mind and won't change the subject." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Matt add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "If you are going through hell, keep going." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Matt add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "I am fond of pigs. Dogs look up to us. Cats look down on us. Pigs treat us as equals." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Matt add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "Never hold discussions with the monkey when the organ grinder is in the room." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Matt add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "Everyone is in favor of free speech. Hardly a day passes without its being extolled, but some people's idea of it is that they are free to say what they like, but if anyone else says anything back, that is an outrage." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Matt add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Matt add a quote by Publilius Syrus
item.description: "I often regret that I have spoken; never that I have been silent." -- Publilius Syrus

item.title: Matt add a quote by Henry Roberts
item.description: "Where there is no law, but every man does what is right in his own eyes, there is the least of real liberty." -- Henry Roberts

item.title: Matt add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Matt add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "The whole modern world has divided itself into Conservatives and Progressives. The business of Progressives is to go on making mistakes. The business of Conservatives is to prevent mistakes from being corrected. Even when the revolutionist might himself repent of his revolution, the traditionalist is already defending it as part of his tradition. Thus we have two great types -- the advanced person who rushes us into ruin, and the retrospective person who admires the ruins. He admires them especially by moonlight, not to say moonshine. Each new blunder of the progressive or prig becomes instantly a legend of immemorial antiquity for the snob. This is called the balance, or mutual check, in our Constitution." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Matt add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Religious liberty might be supposed to mean that everybody is free to discuss religion. In practice it means that hardly anybody is allowed to mention it." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Matt add a quote by G. K. Chesterton
item.description: "The word "good" has many meanings. For example, if a man were to shoot his grandmother at a range of five hundred yards, I should call him a good shot, but not necessarily a good man." -- G. K. Chesterton

item.title: Matt add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "How you think when you lose determines how long it will be until you win." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Matt add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "There is no such joy in the tavern as upon the road thereto." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Matt add a quote by Leslie Knope
item.description: "The library is the worst group of people ever assembled in history. They're mean, conniving, rude, and extremely well-read, which makes them dangerous." -- Leslie Knope

item.title: Matt add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them; that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Matt add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "If you understand others you are smart. If you understand yourself you are illuminated. If you overcome others you are powerful. If you overcome yourself you have strength. If you know how to be satisfied you are rich. If you can act with vigor, you have a will. If you don't lose your objectives you can be long-lasting. If you die without loss, you are eternal." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Matt add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Matt add a quote by Alan Wilson Watts
item.description: "Man suffers only because he takes seriously what the gods made for fun." -- Alan Wilson Watts

item.title: Matt add a quote by Benjamin Hoff
item.description: "Do you really want to be happy? You can begin by being appreciative of who you are and what you've got." -- Benjamin Hoff

item.title: Matt add a quote by C.J. Langenhoven
item.description: "Don't listen to a man who says we have to work together as a team. He means we have to work as he says." -- C.J. Langenhoven

item.title: Matt add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Matt add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Bran thought about it. 'Can a man still be brave if he's afraid?' 'That is the only time a man can be brave,' his father told him." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Matt add a quote by Lucius Annaeus Seneca
item.description: "You ask what is the proper limit to a person's wealth? First, having what is essential, and second, having what is enough." -- Lucius Annaeus Seneca

item.title: Matt add a quote by Seneca
item.description: "Fate leads the willing and drags along the unwilling." -- Seneca

item.title: Matt add a quote by Seneca
item.description: "All cruelty springs from weakness." -- Seneca

item.title: Matt add a quote by Seneca
item.description: "No man was ever wise by chance" -- Seneca

item.title: Matt add a quote by Seneca
item.description: "It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor. " -- Seneca
